column1: Greylin was a river of the far north of Middle-earth.
The Greylin rose in the western Grey Mountains and flowed south-westward to meet the Langwell and together they formed the source of the Great River
Between the two rivers was the Éothéod built Framsburg
The second element of the name derives from Old English hlynn or "torrent"
column2: although its literal meaning was probably "the noisy one".
